description.narrative:
Den planerade insatsen är en portföljgaranti i samarbete mellan Sida-US International Development Finance Corporation (DFC, tidigare USAID/DCA) som syftar till att främja tillgång till finansiering för Diasporarelaterade små och medelstora företag (SME) i Bosnien och Hercegovina (BiH), som arbetar inom den produktiva sektorn för att uppmuntra till ökad produktion, tillgång till exportmarknader, skapande av arbetstillfällen och förbättra den totala ekonomiska tillväxten. Riskdelningen i garantin är att Sida och DFC tillsammans tar upp till 50% av risken (Sida upp till 26% och DFC upp till 74%), eller $ 1 820 000 respektive 5 180 000 $, upp till $ 7 000 000 och ProCredit upp till $ 7 000 000. Garantiperioden är sju år.
Garantistrukturen är flexibel genom att banken kan använda garantin under tre olika risktäckningsnivåer; 30%, 50% och 70%, med ett tak på 1,5 MUSD för 70% risktäckning. Total genomsnittlig riskdelning får inte överstiga 50% på portföljbasis.
Ett önskat resultat är att DFC/Sidas garanti ska ha en demonstrationseffekt på lång sikt, där fler banker tar efter ProCredits exempel, och antar liknande tillvägagångssätt för lån till små och medelstora företag, i synnerhet till diaspora SMEs.
Målet är att underlätta tillgången till finansiering för diaspora-relaterade små och medelstora företag som ofta saknar säkerheter och om de är nystartade företag saknar de också nödvändig kredithistorik.
Den kumulativa förväntade förlusten uppskattas till 184 285 USD vilket motsvarar 1 619 865 SEK när växelkursen 8,79 SEK / USD tillämpas (valutakurs per 2020-08-21). Det totala behovet av subvention för den förväntade förlusten är samma belopp eftersom Sida endast erhåller uppstartsavgiften för garantin från banken, som endast kompenserar en del av de administrativa kostnaderna.
Garantin beräknas mobilisera och möjliggöra utlåning till diaspora SMEs i intervallet 14 MUSD (lägsta belopp baserat på 50% riskandel i genomsnitt av banken) - 23 MUSD (högsta belopp vid 30% risktäckning). Sidas andel av mobiliserat kapital uppgår till 26% av 14 MUSD, dvs 3 640 000 USD , motsvarande 31 995 600 SEK vid en valutakurs om 8.79 SEK/USD.
Om garantin utnyttjas fullt ut kommer den att ha en bra mobiliseringseffekt som bidrar till att öka andelen konkurrenskraftiga små och medelstora företag i Bosnien och Hercegovina och främja välbehövlig ekonomisk tillväxt och sysselsättning i den privata sektorn i Bosnien och Hercegovina, särskilt när det gäller att utveckla disaporarelaterade marknadsnischen.

The envisaged contribution is a Sida-US International Development Finance Corporation (DFC, formerly USAID/DCA) loan portfolio co-guarantee intended to promote access to finance for Diaspora related Micro Small and Medium sized enterprises (SME) in Bosnia and Herzegovina (BiH), working in the productive sector to encourage increased production, access to export markets, job creation and improve overall economic growth. The risk sharing of the guaranteed amount states that Sida and DFC together takes up to 50% of the risk (Sida up to 26% and DFC up to 74%), or $1,820,000 and $5,180,000, respectively up to $7,000,000, and ProCredit up to $7,000,000. The guarantee period is seven years.
The guarantee structure is flexible in that the bank can utilize the guarantee under three different risk coverage levels; 30%, 50% and 70%, with a cap of 1.5 MUSD for loans with 70% risk coverage. The guaranty percentage must not exceed an average of 50% on a portfolio basis.
One desired impact/outcome is that DFC/Sida's guarantee can be demonstrative in the long term. This would be the equivalent of impact level objective in which more banks, building on Procredit's example, adopt similar approaches related to SME lending and Diaspora related SME lending in particular.
The objective is to facilitate the access to finance for Diaspora related SMEs that often lack requirements of collateral and if they are start ups or young companies, they also lack necessary credit history.
The Cumulative Expected Loss is estimated to US $184,285 which corresponds to 1,619,865 SEK when the exchange rate of 8.79 SEK/USD is applied (exchange-rate as of 21 August 2020). The total need for subsidy for the expected loss is the same amount since Sida only receives the Origination fee of the payments from the bank, which will offset only a portion of the Administrative costs.
The Guarantee is estimated to mobilize and unlock the potential in the range of US $14M (lowest amount based on 50% risk share by the bank on average) - US $23M (highest amount) worth of loans for diaspora linked SMEs. Sida's share of the mobilized amounts to 26% of US $14M, ie US$ 3 640 000, corresponding to 31 995 600 SEK when the exchange rate of 8.79 SEK/USD is applied.
The Guarantee, if fully utilized, will have an acceptable leverage and an effect that could contribute to increase the share of competitive SMEs in BIH and promote much needed economic growth and employment of the private sector in BiH, particularly as it is about developing the disapora linked market niche.

Theory of change: Through the provision of a Sida-DFC co-guarantee to ProCredit Bank in Bosnia Herzegovina, the objective is to facilitate the access to finance for Diaspora related SMEs that often lack requirements of collateral and if they are start ups or young companies, they also lack necessary credit history. These SMEs are expected to contribute to much needed growth and employment in BiH, as well as, to support higher levels of export. The contribution is also aimed at increasing the share of competitive SMEs in the economy. Expected Results: The overall aim is to increase economic development and job creation through increased lending to the under served high growth potential Dispora related SMEs in sectors that the Guarantee targets. The expected outcome upon expiration of the guarantee is: - Expansion of the borrowing diaspora related enterprises in terms of scale of operation, profit, number of employees etc. - increased and continued lending to the target groups, esp Diaspora related SMEs with or without green investments, upon expiration of the guarantee by the partner banks and other lenders - Lower requirement for collateral for the borrowers by lenders, and generally improvedloan conditions Desired impact: - Demonstrate to the rest of the financial sector the market for SME loans for business expansion, including lending to dispora related businesses, where collateral requirements and lack of capital markets is a problem for the SMEs. -The development impact is that increased access to credit will promote development and upscaling (into higher value chains) of the productive SMEs, leading to economic growth and more employment opportunities. ProCredit Bank d.d. has a 15-16% share in the SME market and a short term goal to reach 20%. They use an approach where they directly visit about 1000 clients per year, new ones, with a success rate of 21%. The clients targeted include businesses aiming to reduce energy consumption and their impact on the environment. By investing in environmental protection measures, modern machinery and energy efficient business premises, ProCredit seeks competitive advantage in the SME market. The objective of this project is to introduce Diaspora loans in the SME portfolio through the loan portoflio guarantee-LPG. These clients are assumed to be eligible start ups mainly from related DFC/USAID and Sida financed TA and grant projects for SMEs. There are also already a few companies with some years, and some capital, that can grow in ProCredit's existing portfolio but they do not have sufficient collateral to cover entire investment. The LPG provided by DFC/Sida is intended to strengthen the Banks’s ability to provide loans to diaspora-linked businesses in Bosnia and Herzegovina, thereby stimulating economic growth. This Guarantee will be something new on the market.

tag.narrative: 8.10 - Strengthen the capacity of domestic financial institutions to encourage and expand access to banking, insurance and financial services for all.
8.10 - Stärka de inhemska finansinstitutens kapacitet att främja och utöka tillgången till bank- och försäkringstjänster samt finansiella tjänster för alla.

description.narrative: The conclusion on performance is based on recently completed review of the ProCredit guarantees by ILO. The review was commissioned by Sida Eurolatin department. The consultant has this to say about impact of the guarantee: The impact of the guarantee facilities on the financials and employment in a business can only be observed after a certain amount of time has passed. The Consultant recommends tracking the impact of the loan on the beneficiaries business one year after the loan has been disbursed. The financial statements for 2021 have not yet been prepared and submitted by the companies as the deadline is end February each year. Thirteen (13) out of twenty (20) interviewed beneficiaries stated that the loan received has already impacted the growth of their business in terms of sales and expansion. Although this can already be considered as evidence of impact, the information is based on qualitative inputs from the interviews and not precise quantitative data for the whole of the guaranteed portfolio. Measurement of attribution of the guarantee facility to the employment quality is not easy to obtain. Attribution would need to be supported by a control group as there is no public source of data covering all the indicators above. ProCredit Bank does not have the staff dedicated to this type of attribution measurement. If employment quality indicators are to be tracked, the Consultant recommends engaging an outside consultancy for this type of measurement. Although the consultant does not have the quantitative evidence of impact (e.g. new job growth, etc) the qualitative interviews are already pointing to a successful guarantee project Utilization of the guarantee is proceeding as planned. Cumulative utilization is standing at 20%. The bank thinks it will have no problem using the facility in full despite the challenging political environment. 62 companies are currently covered by the guarantee, 17 are woman owned, and a total employment of 1700.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
